title: UCI Road World Championships 2019: Women's road race preview, prediction, route and Yorkshire road closures
text:
Lizzie Deignan will take on the elite women's road race today at the Road World Championships in her home county of Yorkshire, hoping to spring a surprise and win her second world title.

Deignan won in Virginia in 2015 but comes into this race in very different circumstances, having giving birth a year ago to daughter Orla.

Since then she has made an impressive return to the sport, winning The Women's Tour in June, but her ultimate goal has always been to triumph her on the roads she knows better than anyone, and on a course which passes her parents' back garden.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

To win she will need to over the strengths of the Dutch team which contains her old rival Anna van der Breggen and the relentlessly brilliant Marianne Vos.

Here is everything you need to know.

What time does it start?

The race begins at around 11.30pm, and should be wrapped up shortly after 4pm.

Prediction?

Vos has been in such scintillating form this season and won the Tour de Yorkshire in May. She will be too strong for the rest. But as yesterday's drama showed, almost anything can happen.

What are the road closures around Yorkshire?

Join us here later for live updates from the race.
